oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Margarette Shy, sister of Colonel William Shy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cased tintype of Margarette Shy, sister of Col. William Shy, 20th Tennessee, Inf, Regt., CSA. The Shys were from the Del Rio Pike area of Williamson County. Colonel Shy was killed at Battle of Nashville on December 16, 1864. Margarette recovered the body of her brother after his death. He was buried in the family plot. In the 1970s his body was unearthed by relic hunters. He was re-interred in a new casket. The original 1864 casket is at the Carter House in Franklin, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Margarette Shy
